article.headline: Jacksonville St. 66, Eastern Kentucky 56
article.story: JACKSONVILLE, Ala. (AP) -- Senior forward Courtney Bradley scored a game-high 23 points to lead Jacksonville State to a 66-56 win over Eastern Kentucky Thursday night. Bradley hit a 3-pointer with 3:04 left to play to break a 56-56 tie and help the Gamecocks (4-14, 2-7 Ohio Valley Conference) break an eight game losing streak. For the Colonels (10-7, 5-4 OVC), it was the fourth loss in their last five trips to Pete Mathews Coliseum. Harold Crow scored 11 points for the Gamecocks, and Dorien Brown added 10 more. Mike Rose led the Colonels with 15 points. Julian Mascoll scored 13 points, and Darnell Dialls chipped in with 10. The Gamecocks made 52 percent of their shots from the floor, while the Colonels shot 45 percent.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
